intro: Rubus × ripartii, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a hybrid shrub belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, typical of the Rubus genus. The plant produces aggregate fruits, which are typically dark purple to black in color, containing numerous small drupelets. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or disturbed soils. Due to its vigorous growth, it can become invasive in certain regions.
